docs.snippet: Montana U.S. Attorney Michael Cotter has been chosen to head a committee of about 30 U.S. attorneys from Indian Country who advise Attorney General Eric Holder on policy and issues....

docs.snippet: Labannya Hijra, 21, a transgender beggar in Dhaka, Bangladesh, has avoided reporters and the police since capturing two men accused of murdering a blogger....
docs.lead_paragraph: Labannya Hijra, 21, a transgender beggar in Dhaka, Bangladesh, has avoided reporters and the police since capturing two men accused of murdering a blogger.
docs.abstract: Many in Bangladesh praise Labannya Hijra, transgender beggar in Dhaka, for helping police capture two men accused of murdering blogger Oyasiqur Rhaman, who wrote comments critical of Islam on social media.

headline.main: A Transgender Bangladeshi Changes Perceptions After Catching Murder Suspects
headline.print_headline: A Transgender Bangladeshi’s Courage After a Killing Reshapes Perceptions

byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Ellen Barry from New Delhi.
byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and ELLEN BARRY

docs.snippet: The death toll in an assault by Somali militants on a Kenyan university is likely to climb above 147, a government source and media said on Friday, as anger grew among local residents over what they say as a government failure to prevent bloodshed...
docs.lead_paragraph: The death toll in an assault by Somali militants on a Kenyan university is likely to climb above 147, a government source and media said on Friday, as anger grew among local residents over what they say as a government failure to prevent bloodshed.

headline.main: Kenya University Death Toll Seen Rising; Anger Over Security Failures
headline.print_headline: Kenya University Death Toll Seen Rising; Anger Over Security Failures

docs.snippet: Iraqi soldiers spent weeks in a stalemate with militants before American jets went to work, but to hear some tell it, the United States deserves little credit....
docs.lead_paragraph: Iraqi soldiers spent weeks in a stalemate with militants before American jets went to work, but to hear some tell it, the United States deserves little credit.
docs.abstract: Iraqi soldiers give little credit to United States in drive to retake Tikrit from Islamic State.

headline.main: Iraq Forces, Pushing ISIS Out of Tikrit, Give Few Thanks for U.S. Airstrikes
headline.print_headline: Retaking Tikrit, Iraqis Give Little Credit to U.S.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

byline.contributor: Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Tikrit.

docs.snippet: Mr. Emanuel’s challenger, Jesús Garcia, is raising questions about the Democratic Chicago mayor’s top supporter, Kenneth Griffin, a Reagan-Republican billionaire....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Emanuel’s challenger, Jesús Garcia, is raising questions about the Democratic Chicago mayor’s top supporter, Kenneth Griffin, a Reagan-Republican billionaire.
docs.abstract: Billionaire Republican investor Kenneth C Griffin, owner of $26 billion investment firm Citadel, has given almost $1.3 million to Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel's election campaigns since 2010, most of it in 2015; Jesus G Garcia, facing Emanuel in election runoff, accuses him of letting Chicago's wealthy 'pay to play' and says Griffin benefits from relationship with Emanuel.

headline.main: Chicago’s Odd Couple: Mayor Rahm Emanuel and a Billionaire Republican Investor

docs.snippet: The browser history on an iPad while investigating Mr. Lubitz’s apartment in Düsseldorf included search terms about cockpit doors, prosecutors said....
docs.lead_paragraph: The browser history on an iPad while investigating Mr. Lubitz’s apartment in Düsseldorf included search terms about cockpit doors, prosecutors said.
docs.abstract: Investigators find that Germanwings pilot Andreas Lubitz searched Internet for information about how to commit suicide and security measures for cockpit doors days before crashing plane into French Alps, killing all 150 people aboard.

headline.main: Germanwings Pilot Searched Web About Suicide and Cockpit Doors, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Germanwings Pilot Searched Web About Suicide and Cockpit Doors, Officials Say

byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Düsseldorf, Melissa Eddy from Berlin and Nicola Clark from Paris. Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris, and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt.
byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH, MELISSA EDDY and NICOLA CLARK
